text: In the U.S., artists in the mid-1950s began to create a  link  bridge  connection  space  bridge  to Pop and a new style of art, strongly influenced by Dada and its emphasis on appropriation and everyday objects. Artists increasingly worked with  pieces  collage  design  colors  collage , consumer products, and a healthy dose of irony. Jasper Johns re- imagined iconic imagery like the American flag; Robert Rauschenberg employed silk-screen printings and found objects; and Larry Rivers used images of mass- produced goods. These three are considered to be the  ancestors  fathers  forerunners  creators  forerunners  of American Pop.
